info.description: Compete for the land and cities between the rivers while commanding mighty ziggurats
info.helpText:
Have every player take a seat and then press the Setup button to select the appropriate board for the player count, set up initial city and crop tiles, deal every player a starting hand and randomly select a start player.

When you take a seat, your player pieces will be changed to match your player colour set in virtualtabletop. You can stand up, change your colour, and sit down again if you need to update these to e.g. ensure good contrast with other players.

Players can use the +1 and +X buttons to add to their score. The +X prompts you for how many points you are scoring and adds them to your existing score.

After scoring a crop tile, or if a city is scored and then not collected by a player (because of a tie for a majority of surrounding tiles), you can discard the tile to original draw pile for city & crop tiles on the right hand side of the table, below the Setup button.

Store your collected city tiles and ziggurat tiles in the appropriate holders in your player area. After adding a city, click the Score Cities button to score every player's city tiles. (This will also take into account ziggurat 7 for a player that owns it and has placed it in their ziggurat holder.)

At the end of your turn, press the End Turn button to re-draw to your hand size and set the next player as active.
info.ruleText:
PLAYER DECK:
Each player has a deck of tiles containing 12 farmers and 6 each of three different suits of nobles, for 30 tiles in total. The default hand size is five tiles.

PLACING TILES:
On their turn, a player places either two tiles or three or more face-up farmers. (Exception: During the first turn of the game, the first player may place only one tile and the second player may place only two tiles.)

Tiles are placed face-up in unoccupied land spaces, or face-down in unoccupied water spaces. A tile may instead be placed onto a farm tile, claiming and scoring it immediately, but only if the player placing the tile already has a player tile in a hex adjacent to the farm tile. The farm tile showing a grey hex is worth X points, where X is the total number of city tiles collected by all players during the game so far.

When a player places next to a red ziggurat, they immediately score X points, where X is the number of ziggurats they now have a tile next to, including the latest placement.

FINISHING YOUR TURN:
After making their two placements, a player scores all cities and ziggurats on the board which have been newly surrounded (counting land spaces only - the water spaces may optionally be occupied but are not required) during their turn, and then draws back up to their hand size of five tiles.

SCORING CITIES:
When a city scores, first each player scores for all noble tiles matching any of the symbols on the city and connected to it through a contiguous chain of their own player tiles. For each such noble, they score 2 points.

Next, check whether one player has more tiles directly surrounding the city than any other. If they do, then this player collects the city tile. At any point when a player collects a city tile, all players immediately score points equal to the number of cities they have collected during the game, including the newly-collected city. If two or more players are tied for the number of tiles directly adjacent to the newly-surrounded city, then the city tile is instead discarded and players do not score for their existing city tiles.

SCORING ZIGGURATS:
If one player has more tiles directly adjacent to a newly-surrounded ziggurat than any other player, then they collect one ziggurat tile of their choice from the public display and now benefit from its power.

ZIGGURAT POWERS:

1: Immediately gain 10 points.
2: On any one turn, either this turn or a future one, you may after drawing tiles at the end of their turn decide and declare that they are taking an immediate extra turn following the full standard turn sequence.
3: Your hand size is now 7 tiles instead of 5 for the remainder of the game.
4: Instead of the usual placement options on your turn, you may place 1 noble tile of each suit, all face up.
5: When placing 3 or more farmer tiles as your placement for the turn, you may additionally place 1 noble. All these placements must be face up.
6: You may place nobles directly onto farm tiles, claiming them and not requiring any already-adjacent tile as is normally the case for claiming them with a farmer.
7: Any time you score for your collected city tiles, you score 1 extra point for every pair of collected cities.
8: Unoccupied land spaces on the central land area between the two rivers form part of your chains of connected pieces for noble scoring when a city is scored.
9: Unoccipied water spaces form part of your chains of connected pieces for noble scoring when a city is scored.

END OF THE GAME:
The game ends at the end of any player's turn where either: (a) they have no pieces remaining (they have all been placed on the board); or (b) there are 0 or 1 cities left on the game board.

clickRoutine.header: Enter amount to add to ${playerDesc}'s score

clickRoutine.note: Sanity check / typo avoidance 1 of 2: only add value if it is an integer

thenRoutine.note: Sanity check / typo avoidance 2 of 2: only add value if it is a three-digit number

clickRoutine.note: Get the active player seat 1/2
Get the active player seat 2/2
Determine that player's hand size (based on whether they own ziggurat tile 3)
Count the number of tiles in hand 1/2
Count the number of tiles in hand 2/2
Draw extra tiles if not already at hand limit
Move the turn to the next player
Loop through the players

loopRoutine.note: Count the number of cities collected by this player
Check if this player owns ziggurat tile 7 and apply the scoring bonus if they do
Add the appropriate amount to this player's score
loopRoutine.label: score-p${value}

clickRoutine.note: Ask the user whether to use the standard set of ziggurats or a random set - also gives them the opportunity to cancel the rest of this setup routine if clicked by accident
Recall all the ziggurats
Move 7 ziggurats for this game into the ziggurat display
Sort the ziggurat display
Recall the player discs
Move each player's discs to their own holder and shuffle
Get player count 1/3 - select player seats
Get player count 2/3 - filter out empty seats
Get player count 3/3 - count remaining seats
Move all boards off-screen
Select the board to use based on the player count
Move the board onto the screen
Recall the crop and city tiles
Get the list of tiles to remove from the game for the board being used
Iterate through the set of tiles to be removed

loopRoutine.note: Select all tiles of the type being considered
Move those tiles to the setup holder
Move an appropriate number to the removed holder
Move the remainder of the tiles back into the main deck

clickRoutine.note: Shuffle the tiles
Get the list of tile start locations for the board being used
Deal 1 tile to each of these spaces
Move the removed tiles back to the draw-pile holder
Reset all scores to zero
label: score-p1
score-p2
score-p3
score-p4

clickRoutine.note: Draw each seated player a starting hand of 5 tiles
Select a random start player
